summary:
Composer / Live Electronics.

Yu Oda (b.1983) is a composer based in the the Netherlands. His activities include composing for various ensembles/musicians as well as performing live electronics. The list of his compositions has a wide range of styles, and they are characterized in exploring groove and sound colour. Such as open gallery, classic concert hall, underground venue, theatre, radio, film, and religious ceremony, his works have been presented in a wide range of occasions and recognized internationally.

In addition to working as a composer in a traditional manner, Oda has been a member of "Plastiklova", a duo consisting of vibraphone and electronics, and "Project 128", a live techno band, in which he performs live electronics. He has also co-founded a group of Amsterdam-based musicians "stichting Earvision" and worked as artistic director/composer of contemporary music ensembles "Looptail" and "Amsterdam Collage Ensemble".

International music festivals his works have been performed include: Gaudemus Muziekweek (NL), Holland Festival (NL), Oerol Festival (NL), Amsterdam Dance Event (NL), Grachten Festival (NL), Sounds of Music Festival (NL), MATA Festival (US), Darmstadt International Summer Courses (DE), Forum Neuer Musik (DE), Time of Music Festival (FI), Rainy Days Festival (LUX), and Huddersfield Contemporary Music Festival (UK). And, his works have been nominated for Toonzetters (2012), Gaudeamus Prize (2011), as a finalist of Henriette Bosmansprijs and Tera de Marez Oyensprijs (2011), and awarded for the 2nd prize in Young Composers Meeting (2012) and honorable mention of the 32nd Irino Prize.

Oda has worked with groups, ensembles, musicians, and artists, such as: Noord Nederlands Toneel, Noord Nederlands Orkest, United Instruments of Lucilin (LUX), Ensemble Proton (CZ), Scenatet (DK), Joint Venture Percussion Duo, Ensemble Phoenix (CZ), orkest de ereprijs, Kölner Gagaku (DE), Ensemble10/10 (UK), Leo Smit Ensemble, and Asko | Schönberg.

Oda was born in Japan and started his musical activity playing and composing in a rock band. He has studied composition and graduated from California State University, Northridge, and Conservatorium van Amsterdam.

treasury_media.title: Frequency Modulation on RGB Fountain - Modular Synth, Audiovisual Installation
treasury_media.description: Installation of Audiovisual Art and Live Performance - with modular synth, ring modulator, audio analysis of water sounds, and RGB light on the fountain. A synesthetic and immersive experience of frequencies: The project is a collaboration between...

projects.title: Amsterdam Collage Ensemble
projects.description:
Amsterdam Collage Ensemble: a new music collective formed in 2010 combining the contrasting sound-worlds of percussion, recorders and clarinet.

Since a successful debut in the Gaudeamus Music Week 2011, ACE has gone on to perform at such prestigious events as the Holland Festival, and the 3rd International Blokfluit Festival.

ACE, together with sister-ensemble Looptail, is part of the foundation Stichting Earvision, which was recently founded amongst young musicians in Amsterdam.

contributors.headline: Recorder player | clog dancer | music teacher

profile_positions.description:
Plastiklova is an electroacoustic music duo featuring the vibraphone based in Amsterdam. Using a wide range of experiences as percussionist and composer, the duo experiments in intuitive methods to trigger and combine electronics with acoustic sounds of the vibraphone, and introduces the immersive sound world of electroacoustic music in live performances.

The collaboration is between percussionist Laurent Warnier and composer Yu Oda, who met during their studies at Conservatorium van Amsterdam. After finishing studies at Amsterdam and Boston Conservatory, Laurent Warnier currently works as a percussionist and teaches at conservatories in Luxembourg and Amsterdam. Yu Oda graduated from California State University, Northridge, and Amsterdam Conservatory, and he currently works as a composer in various projects around the Netherlands.

Vibraphone: Laurent Warnier (percussionist)
Electronics: Yu Oda (composer)

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/plastiklova
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/plastiklova
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/plastiklova
SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/plastiklova
profile_positions.title: Composer & Electronics

profile_positions.description:
SoundCloud: http://soundcloud.com/project128
YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/theproject128

Acoustic and electronic, listening and dancing, it all comes together under one concept: 128 beats per minute! 

Project 128 is an acoustic-techno band based in Amsterdam, consisting of acoustic and electronic instrumentalists, composers, and DJs. The group explores new sounds and grooves, and presents a live event with a fresh experience that transcends boundaries of acoustic and electronic music.

The project was initiated by Amsterdam-based musicians who are also active in the contemporary classic music field.
profile_positions.title: Composer / DJ&LIve Electronics

profile_positions.description: Looptail is a new music sextet based in Amsterdam, made up of recent graduates of the Conservatorium van Amsterdam. First formed during the Composers' Festival 2011 at the conservatory, the ensemble's main focus is working with composers of the same generation and developing the alternative music scene in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Artistic Director/Composer

profile_positions.description: Amsterdam Collage Ensemble formed in 2010 combining the contrasting sound-worlds of percussion, recorders and clarinet. The ensemble exists as a fluid and evolving entity, providing a platform for contemporary music involving conductors and composers as well as instrumentalists. Comprising musicians and compositional influences from three contintents, this collective aims to explore and inspire new works, expanding the repertoire for these lesser-known instrumental settings and forging new ground.
profile_positions.title: Artistic Director/ Composer
